p: 4. Tools that are unusable. When I need a hammer that happens to be missing, I can’t use other tools—for example, nails. So, the nails “stand out” as having lost their current usefulness: they are “just there” in the box. The more I feel the need for the missing hammer, the more the nails stand out as having lost usefulness. They just stare back at me as if to say: “Can’t be used.” With that, my interest in them takes on a privative cast: I see these once useful things as “just there” and no more.
